ygData.subject: Re: Skills
ygData.msgSnippet: I disagree about throwing. I hunt with an enchanter mostly, and having a ranged attack to pull critters is wonderful. It doesnt really matter if you advance
ygData.messageBody:
I disagree about throwing. I hunt with an enchanter mostly, and having a
ranged attack to pull critters is wonderful. It doesnt really matter if you
advance the skill or not, as even if you miss, the critter still gets peeved
that you tried to hit it and comes runnin after you. So as a tool, throwing
is great. Just dont expect to do any damage.

Praelor


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jay Watamaniuk [SMTP:wertou@...]
> Sent: Saturday, July 03, 1999 6:41 AM
> To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Skills
>
> From: Jay Watamaniuk <wertou@...>
>
> Do NOT spend points on offensive anything. They will develope fast enough
> in
> combat. Save them for later. Put one or two practices into a new skill and
>
> then leave it. for example your next big skill is Sneak just put one or
> two
> and then practice it just by itself.
> I would not worry about learning throwing. In my opinion it doesn't do a
> whole lot.
>
>
> Jitte- 9th Level, Bristlebane
>
>
